intro: Cineraria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils and sunny conditions. Its long, slender stems and lobed leaves are adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Cineraria longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
